1 /*!
  2  * Hasher <http://github.com/millermedeiros/Hasher>
  3  * Includes: MM.EventDispatcher (0.8), MM.queryUtils (0.8), MM.event-listenerFacade (0.3)
  4  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
  5  * @version 0.9.5 (2010/07/28)
  6  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
  7  */
  8 /*
  9  * MM.EventDispatcher
 10  * - Class used to allow Custom Objects to dispatch events.
 11  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
 12  * @version 0.8.1 (2010/07/27)
 13  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 14  */
 15 
 16 /**
 17  * @namespace Miller Medeiros namespace
 18  */
 19 var MM = MM || {};
 20 
 21 /**
 22  * EventDispatcher Object, used to allow Custom Objects to dispatch events.
 23  * @constructor
 24  */
 25 MM.EventDispatcher = function(){
 26 	this._handlers = {};
 27 };
 28 
 29 MM.EventDispatcher.prototype = {
 30 	
 31 	/**
 32 	 * Add Event Listener
 33 	 * @param {String} eType	Event Type.
 34 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 35 	 */
 36 	addEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 37 		if(typeof this._handlers[eType] == 'undefined'){
 38 			this._handlers[eType] = [];
 39 		}
 40 		this._handlers[eType].push(fn);
 41 	},
 42 	
 43 	/**
 44 	 * Remove Event Listener
 45 	 * @param {String} eType	Event Type.
 46 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 47 	 */
 48 	removeEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 49 		if(! this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 50 			return;
 51 		}
 52 		var	typeHandlers = this._handlers[eType], //stored for performance
 53 			n = typeHandlers.length;
 54 		if(n == 1){
 55 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 56 		}else{
 57 			while(n--){ //faster than for
 58 				if(typeHandlers[n] == fn){
 59 					typeHandlers.splice(n, 1);
 60 					break;
 61 				}
 62 			}
 63 		}
 64 	},
 65 	
 66 	/**
 67 	 * Removes all Listeners from the EventDispatcher object.
 68 	 * @param {(String|Boolean)} eType	Event type or `true` if want to remove listeners of all event types.
 69 	 */
 70 	removeAllEventListeners : function(eType){
 71 		if(eType === true){
 72 			this._handlers = {};
 73 		}else if(this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 74 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 75 		}
 76 	},
 77 	
 78 	/**
 79 	 * Checks if the EventDispatcher has any listeners registered for a specific type of event. 
 80 	 * @param {String} eType	Event Type.
 81 	 * @return {Boolean}
 82 	 */
 83 	hasEventListener : function(eType){
 84 		return (typeof this._handlers[eType] != 'undefined');
 85 	},
 86 
 87 	/**
 88 	 * Dispatch Event
 89 	 * - Call all Handlers Listening to the Event.
 90 	 * @param {Event|String} evt	Custom Event Object (property `type` is required) or String with Event type.
 91 	 * @return {Boolean} If Event was successfully dispatched.
 92 	 */
 93 	dispatchEvent : function(evt){
 94 		evt = (typeof evt == 'string')? {type: evt} : evt; //create Object if not an Object to always call handlers with same type of argument.
 95 		if(this.hasEventListener(evt.type)){
 96 			var typeHandlers = this._handlers[evt.type], //stored for performance
 97 				curHandler,
 98 				i,
 99 				n = typeHandlers.length;
100 			evt.target = evt.target || this; //ensure Event.target exists
101 			for(i=0; i<n; i++){
102 				curHandler = typeHandlers[i];
103 				curHandler(evt);
104 			}
105 			return true;
106 		}
107 		return false;
108 	}
109 	
110 };
111 /*
112  * MM.queryUtils
113  * - utilities for query string manipulation
114  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
115  * @version 0.8 (2010/07/28)
116  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
117  */
118 
119 /**
120  * @namespace Miller Medeiros namespace
121  */
122 var MM = MM || {};
123 
124 /**
125  * @namespace Utilities for query string manipulation.
126  */
127 MM.queryUtils = {
128 	
129 	/**
130 	 * Gets full query as string with all special chars decoded.
131 	 * @param {String} [url]	 URL to be parsed, defaults to `location.href`
132 	 * @return {String}	Query string
133 	 */
134 	getQueryString : function(url){
135 		url = url || location.href; //used location.href to avoid bug on IE6 and pseudo query string inside location.hash
136 		url = url.replace(/#[\w\W]*/, ''); //removes hash (to avoid getting hash query)
137 		var queryString = /\?[a-zA-Z0-9\=\&\%\$\-\_\.\+\!\*\'\(\)\,]+/.exec(url); //valid chars according to: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
138 		return (queryString)? decodeURIComponent(queryString[0]) : '';
139 	},
140 	
141 	/**
142 	 * Gets query as Object.
143 	 * - Alias for `MM.queryUtils.toQueryObject( MM.queryUtils.getQueryString(url) )`
144 	 * @param {String} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href.
145 	 * @return {Object}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
146 	 */
147 	getQueryObject : function(url){
148 		return this.toQueryObject(this.getQueryString(url));
149 	},
150 	
151 	/**
152 	 * Convert Query String into an Object
153 	 * @param {String} queryString	 Query String to be parsed
154 	 * @return {Object}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
155 	 */
156 	toQueryObject : function(queryString){
157 		var queryArr = queryString.replace('?', '').split('&'), 
158 			n = queryArr.length,
159 			queryObj = {},
160 			value;
161 		while (n--) {
162 			queryArr[n] = queryArr[n].split('=');
163 			value = queryArr[n][1];
164 			queryObj[queryArr[n][0]] = isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
165 		}
166 		return queryObj;
167 	},
168 	
169 	/**
170 	 * Get query parameter value.
171 	 * @param {String} param	Parameter name.
172 	 * @param {String} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
173 	 * @return {String}	Parameter value.
174 	 */
175 	getParamValue : function(param, url){
176 		var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param + '=([^&]*)'), //matches `?param=value` or `¶m=value`, value = $2
177 			result = regexp.exec(url),
178 			value = (result && result[2])? result[2] : null;
179 		return isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
180 	},
181 	
182 	/**
183 	 * Checks if query contains parameter.
184 	 * @param {String} param	Parameter name.
185 	 * @param {String} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
186 	 * @return {Boolean} If parameter exist.
187 	 */
188 	hasParam : function(param, url){
189 		var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param +'=', 'g'); //matches `?param=` or `¶m=`
190 		return regexp.test(this.getQueryString(url));
191 	},
192 	
193 	/**
194 	 * Converts object into query string.
195 	 * @param {Object} obj	Object with "params => values" pairs.
196 	 * @return {String}	Formated query string starting with '?'.
197 	 */
198 	toQueryString : function(obj){
199 		var query = [],
200 			param;
201 		for(param in obj){
202 			if(obj.hasOwnProperty(param)){ //avoid copying properties from the prototype
203 				query.push(param +'='+ obj[param]);
204 			}
205 		}
206 		return (query.length)? '?'+ query.join('&') : '';
207 	}
208 	
209 };
210 /*
211  * MM.event - DOM Event Listener Facade
212  * - Cross-browser DOM Event Listener attachment/detachment.
213  * - Based on Peter-Paul Koch addEventSimple <http://www.quirksmode.org/js/eventSimple.html>
214  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
215  * @version 0.3 (2010/06/23)
216  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
217  */
218 
219 /**
220  * @namespace Miller Medeiros Namespace
221  */
222 var MM = MM || {};
223 
224 /**
225  * @namespace Utilities for Browser Native Events
226  */
227 MM.event = MM.event || {};
228 
229 /**
230 * Adds DOM Event Listener
231 * @param {Element} elm Element.
232 * @param {String} eType Event type.
233 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
234 */
235 MM.event.addListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
236 	if(elm.addEventListener){
237 		elm.addEventListener(eType, fn, false);
238 	}else if(elm.attachEvent){
239 		elm.attachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
240 	}else{
241 		elm['on' + eType] = fn;
242 	}
243 };
244 
245 /**
246 * Removes DOM Event Listener
247 * @param {Element} elm Element.
248 * @param {String} eType Event type.
249 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
250 */
251 MM.event.removeListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
252 	if(elm.removeEventListener){
253 		elm.removeEventListener(eType, fn, false);
254 	}else if(elm.detachEvent){
255 		elm.detachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
256 	}else{
257 		elm['on' + eType] = null;
258 	}
259 };
260 /*
261  * Hasher Event
262  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
263  * @version 0.2 (2010/04/18)
264  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
265  */
266 
267 /**
268  * HasherEvent Object.
269  * <p>According to the HTML5 spec `hashchange` event should have `oldURL` and `newURL` properties, since the only portion of the URL that changes is the hash I decided to use `oldHash` and `newHash` instead. (http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/history.html#event-hashchange)</p>
270  * @param {String} eType	Hasher Event type.
271  * @param {String} oldHash	Previous Hash.
272  * @param {String} newHash	Current Hash.
273  * @constructor
274  */
275 var HasherEvent = function(eType, oldHash, newHash){
276 	/**
277 	 * Event Type
278 	 * @type String
279 	 */
280 	this.type = eType;
281 	/**
282 	 * Previous Hash value
283 	 * @type String
284 	 */
285 	this.oldHash = oldHash;
286 	/**
287 	 * Current Hash value
288 	 * @type String
289 	 */
290 	this.newHash = newHash;
291 };
292 
293 /**
294  * Returns string representation of the HasherEvent
295  * @return {String} A string representation of the object.
296  */
297 HasherEvent.prototype.toString = function(){
298 	return '[HasherEvent type="'+ this.type +'" oldHash="'+ this.oldHash +'" newHash="'+ this.newHash +'"]';
299 };
300 
301 //-- Constants --//
302 
303 /**
304  * Defines the value of the type property of an change event object.
305  * @type String
306  * @constant
307  */
308 HasherEvent.CHANGE = 'change';
309 
310  /**
311  * Defines the value of the type property of an init event object.
312  * @type String
313  * @constant
314  */
315 HasherEvent.INIT = 'init';
316 
317 /**
318  * Defines the value of the type property of an stop event object.
319  * @type String
320  * @constant
321  */
322 HasherEvent.STOP = 'stop';
323 /*
324  * Hasher
325  * - History Manager for rich-media applications.
326  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
327  * @version 0.9.5 (2010/07/28)
328  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
329  */
330 (function(window, document, location, history, undef){
331 	
332 	
333 	//== Private Vars ==//
334 	
335 		/** @private {String} previous/current hash value */
336 	var _hash, 
337 		
338 		/** @private {Number} stores setInterval reference (used to check if hash changed on non-standard browsers) */
339 		_checkInterval,
340 		
341 		/** @private {Boolean} If Hasher is active and should listen/dispatch changes on the hash */
342 		_isActive,
343 		
344 		/** @private {iframe} iframe used for IE <= 7 */
345 		_frame,
346 		
347 		/** @private {String} User Agent */
348 		UA = navigator.userAgent,
349 		
350 		/** @private {Boolean} if is IE */
351 		_isIE = /MSIE/.test(UA)  && (!window.opera),
352 		
353 		/** @private {Boolean} if is IE <= 7 */
354 		_isLegacyIE = /MSIE (6|7)/.test(UA) && (!+"\v1"), //feature detection based on Andrea Giammarchi's solution: http://webreflection.blogspot.com/2009/01/32-bytes-to-know-if-your-browser-is-ie.html
355 		
356 		/** @private {Boolean} If browser supports the `hashchange` event - FF3.6+, IE8+, Chrome 5+, Safari 5+ */
357 		_isHashChangeSupported = ('onhashchange' in window),
358 		
359 		/** @private {Boolean} If it is a local file */
360 		_isLocal = (location.protocol === 'file:'),
361 		
362 		//-- local storage for performance improvement and better compression --//
363 		
364 		/** @private {Object} @extends MM.EventDispatcher */
365 		Hasher = new MM.EventDispatcher(),
366 		
367 		/** @private {MM.queryUtils} Utilities for query string manipulation */
368 		_queryUtils = MM.queryUtils,
369 		
370 		/** @private {MM.event} Browser native events facade */
371 		_eventFacade = MM.event;
372 		
373 	
374 	//== Private methods ==//
375 	
376 	/**
377 	 * Get hash value stored inside iframe
378 	 * - used for IE <= 7. [HACK] 
379 	 * @return {String}	Hash value without '#'.
380 	 */
381 	function _getFrameHash(){
382 		return (_frame)? _frame.contentWindow.frameHash : null;
383 	}
384 	
385 	/**
386 	 * Update iframe content, generating a history record and saving current hash/title on IE <= 7. [HACK]
387 	 * - based on Really Simple History, SWFAddress and YUI.history solutions.
388 	 * @param {string} hashValue	Hash value without '#'.
389 	 * @private
390 	 */
391 	function _updateFrame(hashValue){
392 		if(_frame && hashValue != _getFrameHash()){
393 			var frameDoc = _frame.contentWindow.document;
394 			frameDoc.open();
395 			frameDoc.write('<html><head><title>' + Hasher.getTitle() + '</title><script type="text/javascript">var frameHash="' + hashValue + '";</script></head><body> </body></html>'); //stores current hash inside iframe.
396 			frameDoc.close();
397 		}
398 	}
399 	
400 	/**
401 	 * Stores new hash value and dispatch `HasherEvent.CHANGE` if Hasher is "active".
402 	 * @param {String} newHash	New Hash Value.
403 	 * @private
404 	 */
405 	function _registerChange(newHash){
406 		newHash = decodeURIComponent(newHash); //fix IE8 while offline
407 		if(_hash != newHash){
408 			var tmpHash = _hash;
409 			_hash = newHash; //should come before event dispatch to make sure user can get proper value inside event handler
410 			if(_isLegacyIE){
411 				_updateFrame(newHash);
412 			}
413 			if(_isActive){
414 				Hasher.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.CHANGE, tmpHash, newHash));
415 			}
416 		}
417 	}
418 	
419 	/**
420 	 * Creates iframe used to record history state on IE <= 7. [HACK]
421 	 * @private
422 	 */
423 	function _createFrame(){
424 		_frame = document.createElement('iframe');
425 		_frame.src = 'about:blank';
426 		_frame.style.display = 'none';
427 		document.body.appendChild(_frame);
428 	}
429 	
430 	/**
431 	 * Get hash value from current URL
432 	 * @return {String}	Hash value without '#'.
433 	 * @private
434 	 */
435 	function _getWindowHash(){
436 		//parsed full URL instead of getting location.hash because Firefox decode hash value (and all the other browsers don't)
437 		//also because of IE8 bug with hash query in local file [issue #6]
438 		var result = /#(.*)$/.exec( Hasher.getURL() );
439 		return (result && result[1])? decodeURIComponent( result[1] ) : '';
440 	}
441 	
442 	/**
443 	 * Checks if hash/history state has changed and dispatch HasherEvent.
444 	 * @private
445 	 */
446 	function _checkHistory(){
447 		var curHash = _getWindowHash();
448 		if(curHash != _hash){
449 			_registerChange(curHash);
450 		}
451 	}
452 	
453 	/**
454 	 * Check if browser history state has changed on IE <= 7. [HACK]
455 	 * - used since IE 6,7 doesn't generates new history record on hashchange.
456 	 * @private
457 	 */
458 	function _checkHistoryLegacyIE(){
459 		var windowHash = _getWindowHash(),
460 			frameHash = _getFrameHash();
461 		if(frameHash != _hash && frameHash != windowHash){ //detect changes made pressing browser history buttons. Workaround since history.back() and history.forward() doesn't update hash value on IE6/7 but updates content of the iframe.
462 			Hasher.setHash(frameHash);
463 		}else if(windowHash != _hash){ //detect if hash changed (manually or using setHash)
464 			_registerChange(windowHash);
465 		}
466 	}
467 	
468 	
469 	//== Public (API) ==//
470 	
471 	/**
472 	 * Hasher
473 	 * @namespace History Manager for rich-media applications.
474 	 * @extends MM.EventDispatcher
475 	 */
476 	this.Hasher = Hasher; //register Hasher to the global scope
477 	
478 	/**
479 	 * Start listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
480 	 */
481 	Hasher.init = function(){
482 		if(_isActive){
483 			return;
484 		}
485 		
486 		var tmpHash = _hash;
487 		_hash = _getWindowHash();
488 		
489 		//thought about branching/overloading Hasher.init() to avoid checking multiple times but don't think worth doing it since it probably won't be called multiple times. [?] 
490 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
491 			_eventFacade.addListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
492 		}else { 
493 			if(_isLegacyIE){
494 				if(!_frame){
495 					_createFrame();
496 					_updateFrame(_hash);
497 				}
498 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistoryLegacyIE, 25);
499 			}else{
500 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistory, 25);
501 			}
502 		}
503 		
504 		_isActive = true;
505 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.INIT, tmpHash, _hash));
506 	};
507 	
508 	/**
509 	 * Stop listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
510 	 */
511 	Hasher.stop = function(){
512 		if(!_isActive){
513 			return;
514 		}
515 		
516 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
517 			_eventFacade.removeListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
518 		}else{
519 			clearInterval(_checkInterval);
520 			_checkInterval = null;
521 		}
522 		
523 		_isActive = false;
524 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.STOP, _hash, _hash)); //since it didn't changed oldHash and newHash should be the same. [?]
525 	};
526 	
527 	/**
528 	 * Retrieve full URL.
529 	 * @return {String}	Full URL.
530 	 */
531 	Hasher.getURL = function(){
532 		return location.href;
533 	};
534 	
535 	/**
536 	 * Retrieve URL without query string and hash.
537 	 * @return {String}	Base URL.
538 	 */
539 	Hasher.getBaseURL = function(){
540 		return this.getURL().replace(/(\?.*)|(\#.*)/, ''); //removes everything after '?' and/or '#'
541 	};
542 	
543 	/**
544 	 * Set Hash value.
545 	 * @param {String} value	Hash value without '#'.
546 	 */
547 	Hasher.setHash = function(value){
548 		value = (value)? value.replace(/^\#/, '') : value; //removes '#' from the beginning of string.
549 		if(value != _hash){
550 			_registerChange(value); //avoid breaking the application if for some reason `location.hash` don't change
551 			if(_isIE && _isLocal){
552 				value = value.replace(/\?/, '%3F'); //fix IE8 local file bug [issue #6]
553 			}
554 			location.hash = '#'+ encodeURI(value); //used encodeURI instead of encodeURIComponent to preserve '?', '/', '#'. Fixes Safari bug [issue #8]
555 		}
556 	};
557 	
558 	/**
559 	 * Return hash value as String.
560 	 * @return {String}	Hash value without '#'.
561 	 */
562 	Hasher.getHash = function(){
563 		//didn't used actual value of the `location.hash` to avoid breaking the application in case `location.hash` isn't available and also because value should always be synched. 
564 		return _hash;
565 	};
566 	
567 	/**
568 	 * Return hash value as Array.
569 	 * @param {String} [separator]	String used to divide hash (default = '/').	
570 	 * @return {Array}	Hash splitted into an Array.  
571 	 */
572 	Hasher.getHashAsArray = function(separator){
573 		separator = separator || '/';
574 		var hash = this.getHash(),
575 			regexp = new RegExp('^\\'+ separator +'|\\'+ separator +'$', 'g'); //match separator at the end or begin of string
576 		hash = hash.replace(regexp, '');
577 		return hash.split(separator);
578 	};
579 	
580 	/**
581 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as a String
582 	 * - alias to: `MM.queryUtils.getQueryString( Hasher.getHash() ).substr(1);`
583 	 * @return {String}	Hash Query without '?'
584 	 */
585 	Hasher.getHashQuery = function(){
586 		return _queryUtils.getQueryString( this.getHash() ).substr(1);
587 	};
588 	
589 	/**
590 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as an Object
591 	 * - alias to: `MM.queryUtils.toQueryObject( Hasher.getHashQueryString() );`
592 	 * @return {Object} Hash Query
593 	 */
594 	Hasher.getHashQueryAsObject = function(){
595 		return _queryUtils.toQueryObject( this.getHashQuery() );
596 	};
597 	
598 	/**
599 	 * Get parameter value from the query portion of the Hash
600 	 * - alias to: `MM.queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, Hasher.getHash() );`
601 	 * @param {String} paramName	Parameter Name.
602 	 * @return {String}	Parameter value.
603 	 */
604 	Hasher.getHashQueryParam = function(paramName){
605 		return _queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, this.getHash() );
606 	};
607 	
608 	/**
609 	 * Set page title
610 	 * @param {String} value	Page Title
611 	 */
612 	Hasher.setTitle = function(value){
613 		document.title = value;
614 	};
615 	
616 	/**
617 	 * Get page title
618 	 * @return {String} Page Title
619 	 */
620 	Hasher.getTitle = function(){
621 		return document.title;
622 	};
623 	
624 	/**
625 	 * Navigate to previous page in history
626 	 */
627 	Hasher.back = function(){
628 		history.back();
629 	};
630 	
631 	/**
632 	 * Navigate to next page in history
633 	 */
634 	Hasher.forward = function(){
635 		history.forward();
636 	};
637 	
638 	/**
639 	 * Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page.
640 	 * - for example `-1` loads previous page, `1` loads next page.
641 	 * @param {int} delta	Relative location to the current page.
642 	 */
643 	Hasher.go = function(delta){
644 		history.go(delta);
645 	};
646 	
647 	/**
648 	 * Removes all event listeners, stops Hasher and destroy Hasher object.
649 	 * - IMPORTANT: Hasher won't work after calling this method, Hasher Object will be deleted.
650 	 * - automatically called on `window.onunload`.
651 	 */
652 	Hasher.dispose = function(){
653 		_eventFacade.removeListener(window, 'unload', Hasher.dispose);
654 		Hasher.removeAllEventListeners(true);
655 		Hasher.stop();
656 		_hash = _checkInterval = _isActive = _frame = UA  = _isIE = _isLegacyIE = _isHashChangeSupported = _isLocal = _queryUtils = _eventFacade = Hasher = window.Hasher = null;
657 		//can't use `delete window.hasher;` because on IE it throws errors, `window` isn't actually an object, delete can only be used on Object properties.
658 	};
659 	
660 	//dispose Hasher on unload to avoid memory leaks
661 	_eventFacade.addListener(window, 'unload', Hasher.dispose);
662 	
663 }(window, document, location, history));
664
